revised_title: Anatomy and Function of Stomachs in Different Animals
tldr: The author examines the stomachs of various animals to understand the process of converting animal and vegetable substances into chyle. They describe the internal structure of different stomachs and discuss the functions of the various parts of the stomach. The study reveals similarities in the digestive process of ruminants and birds with gizzards, and how different animals have adapted their stomach structures to their specific diets.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Animal Physiology
